result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

- $243.00 Court Costs, Payable through Clerk of Court
- $200.00 DNA Surcharge, Payable through Clerk of Court
payment plan approved commencing 10/15/22 at $50.00 per month.

e: DA ad Atty Schmidt    c: DE and New Richmond PD arc
Filed by Atty Schmidt. arc

8:09 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Smestad recites agreement and states they've reached this agreement because victim has not participated. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2- Disorderly Conduct in 22CM411. Attorneys agree to continue this hearing via zoom. Court finds Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to personal appearance for today's proceeding. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 22CM411. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1, & 3-5 in 22CM411. DE confirms address.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

- Court Costs: $243.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
DE to make payments to COC, commencing 10/15/22 at $50 per month

Adjourned at 8:18 AM. bph
Filed by Atty Schmidt.  gll
for DE to appear via zoom on 09/21. Filed by Atty Schmidt. arc      Per SRN, Approved if plea questionnaire is completed. JA advised Atty Schmidt. arc

10:18 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file, DE was authorized to appear by zoom and see's the name on zoom link, DE is not physically present on zoom screen.  Court authorizes warrant- STAYED until next date.  ADA Smestad questions Atty Schmidt on if DE needs an interpreter, Atty Schmidt states DE does not need an interpreter. Court notes at 10:20 AM- DE appears via zoom.  Atty Schmidt states there is an agreement, asking to set PLEAS.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 10:24 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Request to reset hearing and for zoom appearance; filed by Atty Schmidt.  Per SRN on 9-8-2022: "Okay to remove today's PTC and set for plea/sent" JA will let Attys. know. rg/gll

1:16 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. appeared by video via Zoom.  Interpreter Monica M. appeared by video via Zoom.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. DE confirms address. Court reviews file. DE states he understands English. Court advises DE that if he doesn't understand something in English for today's hearing, to let the Court know and Court will have the interpreter translate. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. NG. DE states he lost his job. Court advises DE to contact PD again to see if he will now qualify. Court reserves on appointing Atty Perrin in the mean time. Court sets PSC and will allow DE to appear by Zoom for that hearing. Interpreter does not need to appear at next hearing.   gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Johana L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:51 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekken with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson for today. Defendant Carlos Alberto Vasquez Jr. in court, in custody. Atty Harrelson states DE will need a spanish interpreter. DE doesn't qualify for PD. Atty Harrelson updates DE's address. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court adjourns INIT and will allow interpreter to appear by Zoom. Court orders DE to be held until next court date can be set. Adjourned at 1:56 PM.  gll
